root.name: Rollergames
root.description: Overview RollerGames was designed by renowned Pinball designer Steve Ritchie, and its audio was programmed by Dan Forden, of Mortal Kombat fame. Ritchie made this game in between two of his most famous tables, Black Knight 2000 and Terminator 2: Judgment Day. It was based on a roller derby television show which only lasted for one season. RollerGames was also adapted for the arcade and for the Nintendo Entertainment System. GameplayThis table has the "DEEP FREEZE MAGNA-FLIP" magnet, in which the ball is launched into "THE PIT", where it is propelled through a wireform to a magnet that will hold the ball in front of the top flipper that gives the player a guaranteed shot up the ramp referred to as "THE WALL". There is a randomly-timed feature where THE WALL ramp can score 1 million points, and six consecutive ramp shots can score 8 million points. The game also features three multi-ball drop targets, a left bank of S-K-A-T-E target lights, and the word W-I-L-L-I-A-M-S can be spelled which starts a scoring cycle earning up to 4 million points.
